div.p: The origin of the lexicon is a thoroughly elaborated txt version of Dillmann, Christian Friedrich August. Lexicon linguae aethiopicae, cum indice latino. Adiectum est vocabularium tigre dialecti septentrionalis compilatum a W. Munziger. Lipsiae: Th.O. Weigel, 1865. Additional records were created by the project TraCES (ERC Advanced Grant, Grant Agreement 338756) and follow-up projects at HLCEES, using text editions and other dictionaries including Sylvain Grébaut, Supplément au lexicon linguae aethiopicae de August Dillmann: (1865) et édition du lexique de Juste d'Urbin (1850 - 1855), Paris: Imprimerie Nationale, 1952 and Wolf Leslau, Comparative Dictionary of Geʻez (Classical Ethiopic): Geʻez-English, English-Geʻez, with an Index of the Semitic Roots, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz, 1987

For more details see A. Bausi, ‘Introduction. 150 Years After Dillmann’s Lexicon’, in A. Bausi and E. Sokolinski, eds, 150 Years after Dillmann’s Lexicon: Perspectives and Challenges of Gǝʿǝz Studies, Supplement to Aethiopica, 5 (Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, 2016), 3-10.
